original: Santhavavagga
analyzed: santhava vagga
translated: The Questions of Menander

original: 7. Ghaṭikārapañha
translated: The Chapter about the Thicket🔽The Questions of Ghaṭīkāra

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Though, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṁ sabbaṁ temāsaṁ ākāsacchadanaṁ aṭṭhāsi, na devotivassī’ti.
analyzed: ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanam sabbam temāsam ākāsa chadanam aṭṭhāsi na deva utivassī iti
translated: ‘The whole of Ghaṭīkāra the potter’s house remained for three months with the roof open to the sky, and it did not rain on it,’

original: Puna ca bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: punar ca bhaṇita
translated: and again this was said:

original: ‘kassapassa tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassatī’ti.
analyzed: kassapassa tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassati iti
translated: ‘The hut of the Tathāgata Kassapa was leaking.’

original: Kissa pana, bhante nāgasena, tathāgatassa evamussannakusalamūlassa kuṭi ovassati, tathāgatassa nāma so ānubhāvo icchitabbo?🔽Yadi, bhante nāgasena, ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṁ anovassaṁ ākāsacchadanaṁ ahosi, tena hi ‘tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassatī’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: kissa pana bhante nāgasena tathāgatassa evam ussanna kusala mūlassa kuṭi ovassati tathāgatassa nāma saḥ ānubhāvaḥ icchitabbo  yadi bhante nāgasena ghaṭi kārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanam anovassam ākāsa chadanam ahosi tena hi tathāgatassa kuṭī ovassati iti yam tam micchā
translated: But why, revered Nāgasena, did the hut of the Tathāgata, who had cut off the root of merit, leak? The power of the Tathāgata should be acknowledged.🔽If the house of Ghaṭīkāra the potter did not leak and had a roof of open sky, then the statement that ‘the Tathāgata’s hut was leaking’ is wrong.

original: Yadi tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassati, tena hi ‘ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṁ anovassakaṁ ahosi ākāsacchadanan’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi tathāgatassa kuṭī ovassati tena hi ghaṭi kārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanam anovassakam ahosi ākāsa chadanam ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: If the Tathāgata’s hut was leaking, then the statement that ‘the house of Ghaṭīkāra the potter did not leak and had a roof of open sky’ is wrong.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This double-pronged question has come up. You should resolve it.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā
translated: “Great king, the Blessed One said:

original: ‘ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṁ sabbaṁ temāsaṁ ākāsacchadanaṁ aṭṭhāsi, na devotivassī’ti.
analyzed: ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanam sabbam temāsam ākāsa chadanam aṭṭhāsi na deva utivassī iti
translated: ‘Ghaṭīkāra the potter’s house remained covered with sky for three months, and it did not rain.’

original: Bhaṇitañca—
analyzed: bhaṇitam ca
translated: And he said:

original: ‘kassapassa tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassatī’ti.
analyzed: kassapassa tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassati iti
translated: ‘The hut of the Tathāgata Kassapa leaks.’

original: Ghaṭikāro, mahārāja, kumbhakāro sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo ussannakusalamūlo andhe jiṇṇe
analyzed: ghaṭikāraḥ mahā rāja kumbhakāraḥ sīlavā kalyāṇa dhammo ussanna kusala mūlaḥ andhe jiṇṇe
translated: Ghaṭīkāra the potter was virtuous and of good character, and he had planted wholesome roots. He supported his blind and aged parents

original: mātāpitaro poseti, tassa asammukhā anāpucchāyevassa ghare tiṇaṁ haritvā bhagavato🔽kuṭiṁ chādesuṁ, so tena tiṇaharaṇena akampitaṁ asañcalitaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ vipulamasamaṁ
analyzed: mātā pitaro poseti tassa asammukhāḥ ghare tiṇam haritvā bhagavataḥ  kuṭim chādesu saḥ tena tiṇa haraṇena a kampitam a sañcalitam su saṇṭhitam
translated: and without his knowledge or permission they took the grass from his house and used it to thatch the Blessed One’s hut.

original: pītiṁ paṭilabhati, bhiyyo somanassañca atulaṁ uppādesi ‘aho vata me bhagavā lokuttamo
analyzed: pītim paṭilabhati bhiyyas somanassam ca atulam uppādesi aho vata me bhagavā lokuttamaḥ
translated: Because of that, he experienced unshakable, unagitated, well-established, vast, and unequalled joy. He experienced even more immeasurable satisfaction and happiness, thinking: ‘How well-assured is the Blessed One, the world-surpassing one!

original: suvissattho’ti, tena tassa diṭṭhadhammiko vipāko nibbatto.
analyzed: su vissatthaḥ ti tena tassa diṭṭhadhammikaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatto
translated: ’ This is the result of his action that he experienced in this very life.

original: Na hi, mahārāja, tathāgato tāvatakena vikārena calati.
analyzed: na hi mahā rāja tathāgataḥ tāvatakena vikārena calati
translated: For, sire, the Tathāgata does not move because of such a slight matter.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, sineru girirājā anekasatasahassavātasampahārenapi na kampati na
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja sineru giri rājā aneka sata sahassa vāta sampahārena api na kampati na
translated: As, sire, the Sineru, king of mountains, does not tremble nor quake nor quake violently because of the impact of many hundreds of thousands of winds,

original: calati, mahodadhi varappavarasāgaro anekasatanahutamahāgaṅgāsatasahassehipi na pūrati na vikāramāpajjati;
analyzed: calati mahā udadhi vara ppavara sāgaraḥ na pūrati na vikāram āpajjati
translated: and as the great ocean, the best and most excellent of waters, is not filled nor does it undergo any change because of many hundreds of thousands of great rivers,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato na tāvatakena vikārena calati.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja tathāgataḥ na tāvatakena vikārena calati
translated: even so, sire, the Tathāgata does not move because of such a slight matter.

original: Yaṁ pana, mahārāja, tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassati, taṁ mahato janakāyassa anukampāya.
analyzed: yam pana mahā rāja tathāgatassa kuṭi ovassati tam mahataḥ jana kāyassa anukampāya
translated: But, sire, when the Tathāgata’s hut leaks, it is out of compassion for the great multitude.

original: Dveme, mahārāja, atthavase sampassamānā tathāgatā sayaṁ nimmitaṁ paccayaṁ nappaṭisevanti,🔽‘ayaṁ aggadakkhiṇeyyo satthā’ti bhagavato paccayaṁ datvā devamanussā sabbaduggatito
analyzed: dve me mahā rāja attha vase sampassamānā tathāgatā sayam nimmitam paccayam na paṭisevanti  ayam aggadakkhiṇeyyaḥ satthā ati bhagavato paccayam da tvā deva manussā sabba duggatito
translated: Seeing these two reasons, sire, the Tathāgatas do not accept a self-made requisite,

original: parimuccissantīti, pāṭihīraṁ dassetvā vuttiṁ pariyesantīti ‘mā aññe upavadeyyun’ti.
analyzed: parimuccissanti iti pāṭihīram dassetvā vuttim pariyesanti iti mā aññe upavadeyyun ti
translated: thinking: ‘Having given a requisite to the Blessed One, the Teacher who is worthy of the highest offerings, gods and men will be delivered from all misfortune,’ and thinking: ‘Having shown a miracle, they will seek a livelihood, lest others should find fault.’

original: Ime dve atthavase sampassamānā tathāgatā sayaṁ nimmitaṁ paccayaṁ nappaṭisevanti.
analyzed: ime dve attha vase sampassamānā tathāgatā sayam nimmitam paccayam na paṭisevanti
translated: Seeing these two reasons, the Buddhas do not accept a self-created means of livelihood.

original: Yadi, mahārāja, sakko vā taṁ kuṭiṁ anovassaṁ kareyya brahmā vā sayaṁ vā, sāvajjaṁ
analyzed: yadi mahā rāja sakkaḥ vā tam kuṭim anovassam kareyya brahmā vā sayam vā
translated: If, sire, Sakka or Brahmā or you yourself were to make that hut rainless,🔽it would be blameworthy.

original: bhaveyya taṁyeva karaṇaṁ sadosaṁ saniggahaṁ, ime vibhūtaṁ katvā lokaṁ sammohenti
analyzed: bhaveyya tayā iva karaṇam sa dosam sa niggahaḥ ime vibhūtam katvā lokam sammohenti
translated: That very act would be faulty, would be censurable. They deceive the world by making it appear that they have transcended the world.

original: adhikataṁ karontīti, tasmā taṁ karaṇaṁ vajjanīyaṁ.
analyzed: karonti iti tasmai tam karaṇam
translated: They do what is beyond the power of others to do. Therefore that act should be avoided.

original: Na, mahārāja, tathāgatā vatthuṁ yācanti, tāya avatthuyācanāya aparibhāsiyā bhavantī”ti.
analyzed: na mahā rāja tathāgatāḥ vatthum yācanti tāya a vatthu yācanāya a paribhāsiyāḥ bhavanti iti
translated: The Buddhas do not ask for a site, and because they do not ask for a site they are not dependent on others.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena, so it is, therefore do I accept it.”

original: Ghaṭikārapañho sattamo.
analyzed: ghaṭikārapañho sattamaḥ
translated: The seventh chapter.
